gui

Class YetAnotherChessGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.YetAnotherChessGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public final class YetAnotherChessGame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    Graphic interface of the chess board. It describes everything that is needed to interact with it and shows the user the state of the chess board.
    Author:
    Acevedo Roman and Guillemot Baptiste, based on Delepoulle Samuel's code.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      YetAnotherChessGame(java.lang.String fenDeDeapart, ChesstoryGame chesstoryGame)
      Create everything that we need to draw the chess board, and mostly is an intermediary between Echiquier and ChesstoryGame.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        What happens when you click on the chess board with your mouse !
        2 possibles cases :
        - right click : display informations on the piece in the logs.
        - left click : if no piece is already focused, it focus this one and show, if needed, its possible moves. Else, it tests whether the move is possible or not and do what is needed.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • eventInter

        public void eventInter(int event,
                       java.lang.String s)
        Just an intermediary between Echiquier and ChesstoryGame, it tells to ChesstoryGame when a special event occurs such as castling, check, etc.
        Parameters:
        event - The event (a constant (take a look at ChesstoryConstant))
        s - The text to display, most of time it just tells the color of the concerned player.

      • switchBorder

        public void switchBorder(boolean b)
        Everything is in the name ! Used when entering/leaving browse mode.
        Parameters:
        b - Represents whether we enter or leave browse mode.

      • switchClickable

        public void switchClickable(boolean b)
        Are you really reading this ? I want a brownie !! Switch the mode between browsing and playing.
        Parameters:
        b - Whether we can act on the chess board or not.

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)

      • changeRules

        public void changeRules(java.lang.String[] arrayRulePiece)
        Captain Obvious here : It changes the rules *flies away*
        Used when we load a file, we wrote it for custom games, you put 6 array of string (one for each chess piece) and it cut it to change the move capacities of the chess pieces.
        Parameters:
        arrayRulePiece - A formated array which describes all the chess pieces (take a look at getMoveSet() in Piece).

      • getFEN

        public java.lang.String getFEN()
        Again an intermediary method between ChesstoryGame and Echiquier.
        Returns:
        The FENcode of the current chess board.

      • CreationChessboard

        public javax.swing.JLayeredPane CreationChessboard()
        Ask Roman, the Bigfoot, I don't know what it is ...
        Returns:
        The layered pane.

      • getArrayRulePiece

        public java.lang.String[] getArrayRulePiece()
        Used to save a game, this array will be on top of the save file.
        Returns:
        An array with the pieces move set

      • getPiecesFancyMoveSet

        public java.lang.String getPiecesFancyMoveSet()
        Used to display the rules, it returns a string which is "readable".
        Returns:
        A beautiful string which describes the chess pieces we currently play with.

      • changeTheme

        public void changeTheme(java.awt.Color[] theme)
        We did not use it a lot cause of time and bad color tastes ...
        Parameters:
        theme - The theme (a constant => ChesstoryConstant).

        Used for closing YACG from the inside

        displayHelp - the displayHelp to set
